intro: Saurauia amdjahii, commonly known as the Andean snowberry, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean highlands. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pinkish flowers and evergreen leaves. It typically grows in rocky or mountainous terrain at high altitudes. Saurauia amdjahii is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to thrive in harsh environmental conditions.
